entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 2:56AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Today and Tonight... Snow will fall along the coast, in the plains, and in the foothills of the Eastern Brooks Range today and tonight. entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:36PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On Rivers Across The Southeast Interior This Week... Glacial rivers draining the Alaska Range such as the Tanana, Chisana, and Nabesna Rivers are near bankfull. This is due to high freezing levels causing significant high elevation snow melt in the Alaska Range. Periods of heavy showers over the Southeast Interior Sunday

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 13 at 7:05AM PDT until July 13 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Hot, Dry, and Windy Conditions Wednesday Afternoon... .Abnormally hot conditions under the ridge has already created critically dry conditions east of the Cascades. As an upper level trough moves in behind the ridge, winds during the afternoon will become gusty. This will result in critical conditions Wednesday afternoon.

entry.title: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 12:56AM PDT until July 14 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...KING TIDES WILL CAUSE MINOR COASTAL FLOODING AT LOW LYING SPOTS DURING HIGH TIDE LATE EACH NIGHT THIS WEEK... .The highest astronomical tides of the year, commonly referred to as the King Tides, will again impact the coast and bayshore each night this week through late Thursday night and have historically resulted in the localized flooding of specific low lying areas
